challenge.summary: A global fashion retailer with $500M+ annual revenue was struggling with fragmented attribution across their multi-channel marketing campaigns. They had limited visibility into which touchpoints were driving actual conversions, leading to suboptimal budget allocation and missed growth opportunities.
points: Limited understanding of customer journey complexity

solution.summary: We implemented a comprehensive data-driven attribution model combined with media optimization strategies that provided clear visibility into the true impact of each marketing touchpoint.

challenge.summary: A rapidly growing B2B SaaS platform was facing high customer churn rates that were impacting their unit economics and growth trajectory. They needed to identify at-risk customers early and develop targeted retention strategies.
points: High churn rate affecting customer lifetime value
Inability to predict which customers would churn
Generic retention campaigns with low effectiveness

solution.summary: We developed a comprehensive predictive churn model combined with personalized retention campaigns that identified at-risk customers weeks before they would typically churn.

steps.title: Behavioral Analysis
steps.description: Analyzed user engagement patterns and product usage data

steps.title: Predictive Modeling
steps.description: Built machine learning models to predict churn probability

steps.title: Retention Campaigns
steps.description: Designed personalized intervention strategies for at-risk segments

results.summary: The predictive model achieved 85% accuracy in identifying at-risk customers, enabling proactive retention efforts that significantly improved customer lifetime value and reduced churn.

challenge.summary: A leading fintech company specializing in digital banking was struggling with high customer acquisition costs and unclear understanding of which marketing activities were driving quality customers versus low-value sign-ups.
points: High customer acquisition costs across channels
Difficulty distinguishing quality vs. quantity in acquisitions
Complex customer journey spanning multiple touchpoints

solution.summary: We applied causal inference modeling to understand the true incremental impact of marketing activities, combined with sophisticated cross-channel optimization to improve both acquisition quality and cost efficiency.

steps.title: Incrementality Testing
steps.description: Designed experiments to measure true causal impact of campaigns

steps.title: Quality Modeling
steps.description: Built models to predict customer lifetime value at acquisition

steps.title: Cross-channel Optimization
steps.description: Optimized budget allocation based on incremental value

results.summary: The causal inference approach revealed significant over-attribution to certain channels and identified high-impact, low-cost opportunities that dramatically improved marketing efficiency while maintaining acquisition quality.
